settings.title: Travel Sickness Medicine
settings.subtitle: Travel sickness medicines are tablets and patches for those that have motion sickness. The medicine contains the ingredient hyoscine hydrobromide, for treating symptoms like nausea and dizziness.

settings.title: How does it work?
settings.text: Travel Medicines contain the ingredient hyoscine hydrobromide which is used for the treatment of feelings of nausea or sickness during travel. Hyoscine helps to stabilise the brain by blocking muscarinic (receptors) that give signals to the brain signifying nausea.

settings.title: When should I use Travel Sickness Medicine?
settings.text: If you are travelling and have often felt nauseous and sick due to the motion, Travel sickness patches and medicines will be right for you. These patches can be applied a few hours before travel to avoid feeling sick during travel.

settings.title: of people will suffer travel sickness
settings.text: According to Media.RAC, as many as 1 in 5 people will continue to feel nausea or sickness as a driver or passenger.

settings.title: of people are considered highly susceptible to motion sickness
settings.text: According to Medline Plus, about 1 in 3 people are likely to get motion sickness.

settings.title: What is travel sickness?
settings.text: Travel sickness is a condition that affects people during travel as it is triggered by movement. It is a mild condition. The symptoms are nausea and dizziness. The symptoms usually go away when the travelling stops.

settings.title: When should you take the medicine?
settings.text:
The travel sickness patches can be applied five to six hours before the travel ideally. The patch can also be applied during travel to reduce symptoms.

Medication (tablets) should be taken as per the dosage on the leaflet before travelling.

settings.title: How to use the travel sickness patches?
settings.text: The patch can be applied to a dry, hairless area for it to be fully effective. The skin behind the ear is the most suitable area. Read the instructions on the leaflet for more directions.

settings.title: How long does it last?
settings.text: Depending on the strength of the medication and its type, usually travel sickness will last for about six to eight hours.
